citeinfo.title: Density Estimates for Rough-toothed dolphin: Atlantic Spring

citeinfo.othercit: DoN (Department of the Navy). 2007. Navy OPAREA Density Estimates (NODES) for the Northeast, Southeast, and Gulf of Mexico OPAREAS. Prepared by Geo-Marine, Inc., Corporate office: Plano, Texas.

DoN (Department of the Navy). 2007. Density Estimates for Rough-toothed dolphin: Atlantic Spring. Navy OPAREA Density Estimates (NODES) for the Northeast, Southeast, and Gulf of Mexico OPAREAS. Prepared by Geo-Marine, Inc., Corporate office: Plano, Texas.

descript.purpose: This data layer was created for use in a Navy Fleet Forces Command project summarizing the Density Estimates and information relevant to a Navy operating areas in the the Northeast, Southeast, and Gulf of Mexico.
descript.abstract: Density estimates of cetaceans and sea turtles. The density estimates are needed to assist in the determination of the potential impacts of military operations to marine mammal and sea turtle species and aid in the preparation of associated take permit authorizations and Section 7 Consultation. See report for more information.

idinfo.accconst: These data were provided to the Navy for use in DOD planning. For any other use please contact Joel T. Bell.

attracc.attraccr: A multi-stage, standardized error checking process is used to verify both attribute accuracy and logical consistency throughout data production. The process includes standardized data entry procedures, file and attribute naming conventions, multiple consistency checks that test for missing or duplicate data as well as a hardcopy data review by GIS and scientific experts. VBA automation is used for some of the data entry and consistency checks.

horizpa.horizpar: Shapefile geometry was developed using bathymetry and EEZ boundary data. Bathymetric contours were developed using gridded datasets from the National Geophysical Data Center. Spatial accuracy of the bathymetric data are cited as "variable" by the originators. EEZ boudary accuracy was based on 1:250,000 maps.

procstep.procdesc:
A shapefile grid was created using the density center points generated by the program "Distance version 6.0 Beta 1". The length and width of the cells were determined by the difference between the center points provided. The attributes from the density points was then spatially joined to the shapefile. Any grid cells that did not have a density point to join to were deleted. The shapefile was then clipped to the study area and projected into North America Albers Equal Area Conic. Areas in kilometers where then calculated per cell. See report for more information.
Distance version 6.0 Beta 1 citation is as follows:
Thomas, L., Laake, J.L., Rexstad, E., Strindberg, S., Marques, F.F.C., Buckland, S.T., Borchers, D.L., Anderson, D.R., Burnham, K.P., Burt, M.L., Hedley, S.L., Pollard, J.H., Bishop, J.R.B. and Marques, T.A. 2006. Distance 6.0. Beta1. Research Unit for Wildlife Population Assessment, University of St. Andrews, UK. http://www.ruwpa.st-and.ac.uk/distance/

srcinfo.srccontr: NMFS (National Marine Fisheries Service) 2006. U.S. Atlantic and Gulf of Mexico Marine Mammal Stock Assessment. Silver Spring, Maryland: National Marine Fisheries Service.
